int cvm_drv_init ( void   ) 

Core: The application should call this routine when it's doing global initialization from only one of the cores its running on.

This routines sets up the PCI ports.

void cvm_drv_local_init ( void   ) 

Core: The application should call this routine when its doing its per-core local initialization.

This routine sets up the scratchpad registers used by the driver.

int cvm_drv_process_instr ( cvmx_wqe_t *  wqe  ) 

Core: Common routine to parse all driver instructions.

This routine looks up the opcode to find a handler that's registered for this opcode. If no handler is found, the wqe is freed. If a handler was found, the handler is called with the WQE. The handler is expected to free the WQE after its processing.

Parameters:
wqe - the work queue entry that contains the instruction.
Returns:
0 if a handler is found for the opcode; else 1.

int cvm_drv_register_op_handler ( uint16_t  opcode,
int(*)(cvmx_wqe_t *)  handler 
)

Core: Register a handler for an opcode.

When the driver sees the opcode, it will call the function registered for the opcode.

Parameters:
opcode - register this opcode.
handler - register this function. Call it with the WQE pointer when a raw instruction with the opcode above is received.
Returns:
0 if the handler was registered successfully, else 1.

void cvm_drv_setup_app_mode ( int  app_mode  ) 

Core: Sets the application type.

The application type registered by this call is passed to the host when the core driver sends the start notification in cvm_drv_start(). Application types are defined in driver/common/octeon-drv-opcodes.h

Parameters:
app_mode,: application type.

int cvm_drv_start ( void   ) 

Core: This routine sends a notification to the host driver is ready to accept instructions.

The application should call this from only one of its cores.
